intro: Blakea tetroici, commonly known as the four-lobed Blakea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. Blakea tetroici is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
